doc.field: The series includes the various bound volumes in the collection. These include 14 volumes of copies of Smith's outgoing, typed letters from 1904-1925. (Series I includes handwritten drafts of at least some of Smith's outgoing letters.) One volume includes summaries of events/actions related to Smith's legal matters for years 1913-1924, which can serve as something of a guide for some of the documents found in Series III. Five volumes relate to his work on damage claims and assessments in connection with street openings. 15 volumes include Smith's notes he took as a student at Columbia Law School and two volumes include his later reference notes on various case law. Other volumes, many of them pocket size and sometimes obscure in purpose, are account books (including one of 1883 for the People's Ice Company), daily calendars, receipt and check stubs, and a few other small items.
